title: Mac Computer: Freezing for no reason
body: I've been playing league for about 3 years now on my mac computer, and for the most part league ran perfectly. Always around 60 Fps under 50 ping. The thing is recently (around patch 7.4 ish) my whole computer started crapping up whenever i get into a game. I get into game and BOOOM my screen freezes for like 1 min i get back, go into lane BOOOM freeze again and for the first 10-5 min of the game i keep freezing as the game goes it gets better. Is anyone else dealing with this and is there a solution?

replies.body:
We've seen some reports like this for some mac players, and we've discovered a potential issue with the shake mouse to locate feature.  Disabling that might be able to help here.

* Launch System Preferences and select Dock
* Navigate to the Applications folder and select Accessibility - [screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/YsdJxd9.jpg) -
* Click on Display and un-check Shake mouse pointer to locate - [screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/PUrYDpv.jpg).) -

Test it in a custom and let me know if that works out for you!

This is not the issue--I do not have that setting enabled and never have, but still experience the same freezing whenever the mouse is allowed to sit still. It occurs in fullscreen and borderless, but not in a window. But it's annoying to have to play the game in a window.
I'm having this same issue. Whenever my mouse sits still the whole game freezes just like you guys have mentioned. Really hoping there is a fix relatively soon.
